bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, April 20, 1936

div1.p: Kean inquires about Truby's recollections of the circumstances of Lazear's contraction of yellow fever. He informs Truby that the Cubans intended to memorialize the room at Las Animas where Lazear was said to have been bitten. Kean informed them that this was not true.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, April 20, 1936

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
April 20
1936

div1.p:
I hear that you are enjoy-
ing life, playing golf and meeting
many old friends in F. F.

I had a call from a very culti
vated fine Cuban Dr Domingo
Ramos who brought me a letter
of introduction and a box of
cigars from an old friend-
Dr. R. is the Director of Sanitation
of Cuba and we naturally had
many things of interest to talk
about- He is planning to put up
a tablet or marker in the room
at Las Animas Hospital where
AC
T
2
Lazear was bitten by the fatal
mosquito, and he was much sur-
prised when I told him that
the story that Lazear was infected
by a wild stegomyia at Las Ani-
mas was, I believed, a fable, and
that his case was a truly ex-
perimental one caused by the bite
of one of his own mosquitoes-

It took place didnt it in his
little laboratory room in the
building at the hospital at
Marianao where he & Carroll
lived? I told him that you knew
more about this than any one
else and that I would write
to you and find out about it-
So come on now - scratch your head
and tell me all about it- I think
that Agramonte told me that Lazear
put the mosquito on the cavalry
private X. Y. (Wm A. Dean) there-
Dr Ramos was up here to a meet-
ing of Sanitary Officers of the
Pan American Republic & there was
a meeting of State Health Officers
here too- You know of course
that Surg. Gen. Cumming was
retired & Parrau is now D. G.

You will doubtless see in the
papers that Arthur died yester-
day at Walter Reed of uremia-
aged 80-

Ireland was in to see me Thurs-
day. He was just back from a
trip to Florida where he went
to get Mrs Ireland & he took along
AC
T
4
for company Mrs Tallie Bell (aged
78) and Mrs Winter!

He found me in bed with an
attack of this confounded Parosys-
mal filrillation & rarythmia that
I have from time to time - once
or twice a month- But I enjoyed
his visit in spite of the misbehavior
of the old pump-

Mrs Kean joins me in cordial
regards to you and to that fine
handsome woman your wife
